revised_title: Observations on the Variation of the Magnetic Needle in the Years 1760-1762
tldr: The author, Mr. David Ross, presents a set of observations on the variation of the magnetic needle made on board the Montagu Man of War during the years 1760, 1761, and 1762. The observations were compared with the Variation Chart published in 1756 and showed a considerable increase in variation near the coast of Portugal, Cape Saint Vincent, and around Gibraltar. The author suggests that these changes may be due to local attractions in the West Indies and recommends further investigation into the cause of these phenomena.
